decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use Cloudpost ramp to quickly generate large amounts of mana in order to cast big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes several disruptive elements like Force of Will and Kozilek's Command to protect its game plan. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and filtering effects like Nulldrifter and Stock Up to help find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient ramp.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to establish a lock on the game, restricting the opponent's options and controlling the board. With cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value with cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck also has a strong late-game threat in Emrakul, the Aeons Torn while utilizing mana acceleration from Grim Monolith and the Urza lands to quickly assert dominance on the battlefield.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while maintaining a steady stream of threats to pressure them. With a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, along with powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and Scythecat Cub, the deck is able to control the game early on and finish off the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Orcish Bowmasters add versatility and extra value to the deck, providing card advantage and removal options. The mana base is well-balanced to support the various spells and creatures in the deck.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of using Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill the library, trigger Narcomoeba and Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for the win. It utilizes protection in the form of Force of Will and interaction with Swords to Plowshares and Stifle. The deck also includes cards like Murktide Regent and Nadu, Winged Wisdom for additional threats. The mana base includes dual lands, fetch lands, and Urza's Saga to support the combo strategy.

The main idea of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly assemble a combo using Nomads en-Kor, Cephalid Illusionist, and Narcomoeba to mill the library and win the game using Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Prismatic Ending to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Urza's Saga provides additional redundancy for finding key pieces, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom offer card advantage and extra value. Overall, the deck aims to win through a powerful and fast combo strategy.

This Combo - Cephalid Breakfast deck focuses on using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill through the library, triggering Narcomoeba and Dread Return to bring back creatures and win the game with a Thassa's Oracle or Nadu, Winged Wisdom combo. The deck includes protection with Force of Will and Daze, along with card filtering with Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and card advantage, while Brazen Borrower and Prismatic Ending offer removal options. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the board, and the mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing equipment and removal spells to control the board. It leverages the Death & Taxes strategy of taxing the opponent's resources and mana while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds a powerful late-game advantage to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually close out the game with powerful threats and equipment.

The deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly. It includes cards like Street Wraith and Thassa's Oracle for win conditions, along with support cards like Quantum Riddler and Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize, along with card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. The goal is to set up a winning pile with Doomsday and control the game with efficient spells like Daze and Dark Ritual. The deck is designed to be fast and deadly in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on locking down opponents with cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon while quickly ramping up mana with Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox. Laelia, the Blade Reforged and Pyrogoyf provide aggressive threats, supported by burn spells like Fury and Shatterskull Smashing. Chalice of the Void helps control the opponent's spells, while Karn, the Great Creator can shut down artifact-based strategies. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and quickly overwhelm them with powerful creatures and burn spells.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively use disruptive elements like Magus of the Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly deploying powerful threats like Pyrogoyf and Fury. The deck also utilizes artifacts like Chrome Mox and The One Ring to ramp up mana production and enable explosive plays. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression, leveraging the powerful synergy between the cards in the deck to quickly close out games.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to accelerate mana production. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Cavern of Souls ensures that your Eldrazi spells cannot be countered. With a mix of Eldrazi creatures and mana acceleration, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game as quickly as possible before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The focus of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Sun. It also aims to finish the game quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells like Sundering Eruption. The deck's high mana acceleration allows for explosive plays early in the game, putting pressure on the opponent and forcing them to react to the threats on the board. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through elves to play big creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It utilizes cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to draw additional cards and keep the combo going. Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith allow for grabbing key creatures from the deck, while Quirion Ranger and Heritage Druid help to untap creatures and generate even more mana. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and finish the game in one explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Heritage Druid, Birchlore Rangers, and Gaea's Cradle, while also drawing cards with Elvish Visionary and Glimpse of Nature. The goal is to ramp up to play key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth or Terastodon, either by searching for them with cards like Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith, or by casting them for free with Allosaurus Shepherd. The deck also includes control elements like Quirion Ranger and Wirewood Symbiote to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on using a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Daze, Lightning Bolt, and Molten Collapse, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Nethergoyf, and Murktide Regent to win the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and additional options for controlling the board. The mana base consists of dual lands like Underground Sea and Volcanic Island, along with fetch lands like Misty Rainforest and Scalding Tarn to ensure consistent mana access. Wasteland is included for additional disruption against opposing lands.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and disrupt the opponent's strategy by using ramp and hate cards like Magus of the Moon. The goal is to play powerful threats like Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker early in the game to apply pressure and maintain control of the board. With a mix of acceleration cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, along with land destruction through Magus of the Moon, this deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in order to win before the opponent can set up their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Life from the Loam, and Exploration to quickly assemble powerful land combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland and Pithing Needle to shut down the opponent's key cards. By generating value through lands and controlling the board, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm opponents in a slow and steady grind towards victory.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through the use of lands and disruptive spells. It utilizes cards like Urza's Saga, Dark Depths, and Thespian's Stage to generate powerful threats while also playing disruption with cards like Wasteland and Maze of Ith. By utilizing Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam, the deck can consistently find and recur key lands. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale adds extra protection and disruption to ensure the deck can navigate the game to its advantage.

This combo deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using artifacts like Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith, while utilizing cards like Voltaic Key and Manifold Key for untapping. Mystic Forge allows the player to play cards from the top of their library, potentially setting up a game-winning combo. The deck also includes powerful artifact tutors like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to find key pieces. The goal of the deck is to assemble a powerful board state with artifacts and mana generation, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with powerful plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing various artifacts and mana ramping tools to quickly assemble the Mystic Forge combo. By combining cards like Voltaic Key, Manifold Key, and Grim Monolith with Mystic Forge, players can cast spells from the top of their library for huge advantage. Tezzeret and Karn provide additional support and utility, while Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern help disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to create a powerful board state and overwhelm opponents with a combination of card advantage and efficient mana generation.

The focus of this deck is to use the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. The deck contains cards that facilitate this combo, such as Goblin Engineer and Tersa Lightshatter, as well as protection cards like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge. Other cards like Goblin Welder and Phyrexian Devourer help to support the combo and provide additional flexibility. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately winning the game through the mill strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then bring them back to the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows for explosive plays and overwhelming opponents with strong creatures early in the game. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask to control the opponent's hand, while utilizing fast mana like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to accelerate the reanimation process. The focus is on executing a powerful combo to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on quickly resolving powerful creature spells, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes cards like Omniscience and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to generate mana advantage and control the board. The deck includes a variety of counter spells and cantrips to protect its combo pieces and dig for key cards. Overall, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents with its big creatures while controlling the game with disruption spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions while utilizing the Stiflenought combo of Phyrexian Dreadnought and a creature with a low mana cost to bring out Emrakul, the Aeons Torn quickly. Show and Tell can also be used to cheat Emrakul onto the battlefield. The deck includes a variety of disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Dress Down to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. Additionally, there are some card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces of the combo.

The deck is focused on quickly generating mana with cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with efficient rituals like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual. The goal is to assemble a large storm count via cheap cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Duress and Thoughtseize. The win condition is usually casting Tendrils of Agony after generating a high storm count. The deck also includes cards like Ad Nauseam and Past in Flames for additional card advantage and recursion, making it a powerful and efficient combo deck in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Legacy combo deck is to utilize various spells and creatures in order to manipulate the library and ultimately win the game by playing Thassa's Oracle to win the game when there is no more library to draw from. The deck includes cards like Chalice of the Void, Force of Will, and Impulse to disrupt opponents while stocking up on resources. By controlling the game and manipulating the library efficiently, the deck aims to set up a win condition with Thassa's Oracle for a quick and effective victory.

The deck focuses on using cards like Entomb and Reanimate to quickly bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard, like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's hand and counter their spells with Force of Will. The deck is able to generate card advantage and filter through the deck efficiently with cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful reanimation spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck utilizes a combination of disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo from being interrupted, while also using cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent for additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with reanimated creatures and control elements to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency with fetch lands and dual lands, and there are also versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide additional interaction. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful threat and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while controlling the game with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The key strategy is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to win the game quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient discard spells, like Thoughtseize, to disrupt the opponent while setting up the graveyard with cards like Entomb. This allows for powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, to be reanimated quickly using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. Control elements like Force of Will and Brazen Borrower provide protection and interaction, while card draw and manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help ensure consistency. The deck aims to combo off and overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively with low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the tempo of the game. The card selection and filtering provided by spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help ensure consistency and maximize the deck's chances of drawing into its powerful threats. Additionally, land disruption with Wasteland provides additional advantage in disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature attacks and efficient spells. By utilizing cheap and disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, alongside powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Dragon's Rage Channeler help with card selection and maintaining a fast pace throughout the match.
